01.About Me

Hello! My name is Evie and I am a self taught web developer.

Coming from a non-tech background, I was inspired to learn to code after getting involved in building tech solutions at my previous supply chain role and being encouraged by other passionate coders. Over the past two years, I have been self-teaching full stack web development and practicing by making clones of various websites, including Airbnb, Trello and Reddit.

Before making a career change, I was in supply chain related roles for 5 years. During which, I had worked with extensive data on a daily basis and have done projects including data modeling, building databases and system implementation to manage data and streamline business processes. Those were some of my favorite projects and are what initially sparked my interest in learning software development.

In my spare time, i love travelling, disc-golfing, cooking, spending time with my baby (oh yes, I also had a newborn last year and self taught being a mom!) and cuddling with my kitties.

Here are a few technologies I’ve been learning and using:

    BackendFrontend
  • Python (Django)
  • Javascript
  • Ruby on Rails
  • jQuery
  • C# (.NET)
  • React
  • PostgreSQL
  • Next.js
02.Some Projects I've Built
Clone Project
Trello Clone
This clone app resembles the ui design of the workflow app trello.com and incudes board, list and card creation, checkboxes, due date, drag + drop features and AJAX updates.
  • Python
  • Django
  • jQuery
  • vanilla js
Clone Project
Airbnb Clone
This clone app is implemented host and guest functionality, listing and booking management features, host communication/chat with sockets, google maps integration.
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Bootstrap
  • jQuery
  • vanilla js
Clone Project
Reddit Clone
This clone app features user registration, community and post creation, upvotes/downvotes, SPA + API architecture.
  • C#
  • .NET
  • Next.js
  • React
03.Where I've worked (before coding)
Hidrate Inc.
The Bradford Group
Pinduoduo Inc.
Sr. Supply Chain Manager @ Hidrate
Nov. 2017 - Jan. 2023
  • Initialized plans and solutions throughout supply chain operations to support company growth. Below are some key contributions in several areas:
  • Management: Recruited and overseen the supply chain team across two office locations (US and China), and ensured smooth operation in areas of vendor & product sourcing, sales forecast & purchasing, production scheduling, shipping & logistics and quality control.
  • Sourcing: Sourced and onboarded new key manufacturers in China for new product needs.
  • Logistics & Shipping: established a balanced shipping strategy to achieve significant freight savings as well as on schedule arrivals.
  • 3PL management: Led the transition of domestic 3PL provider, as well as the sourcing and onboarding of two international 3PLs in Canada and Netherlands.
  • Systems implementations: designed new databases/workflows through Quickbase and led internal ERP system integration, which largely reduced manual data entry and errors.
  • Sales forecast and purchasing: established routine reports to review historical sales, form purchasing plans and manage ongoing production schedules.
Production Scheduler @ The Bradford Group
Sep. 2016 - Oct. 2017
  • Collaborated with cross-functional teams to initiate purchase plans.
  • Placed finished goods and component purchase orders to meet sales forecasts.
  • Managed production timelines with manufacturers to ensure on time deliveries.
  • Monitored shipping and order fulfillments with internal warehouse.
Imported Products Division Manager @ Pinduoduo Inc.
Aug. 2015 – Mar. 2016
  • Head of imported products division for company’s rapidly growing e-commerce marketplace app, Pingduoduo.
  • Performed market research to select and evaluate profitable products.
  • Sourced and onboarded new sellers.
  • Managed and prioritized app listings and promotions for maximum sales efficiency.
